title: Beef Stifado in the Slow Cooker Recipe
description: This Greek stifado features chunks of beef slow-cooked until tender with onion, shallots, herbs, and spices in a rich and aromatic tomato sauce.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Stews Beef Beef Stifado in the Slow Cooker 4.3 (13) 10 Reviews 3 Photos Greek stifado is a beef stew and my all-time favorite Greek dish. Chunks of tender beef are cooked with shallots in a rich, aromatic tomato sauce. Serve with boiled rice and a good supply of crusty bread to mop up the decadent sauce! By Allrecipes Member Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 6 hrs 10 mins Total Time: 6 hrs 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided 2 pounds cubed beef stew meat 1 large onion, roughly chopped 2 cloves garlic, crushed 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 2 large bay leaves 1 sprig fresh rosemary 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1⁄16 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste salt to taste 1 cup red wine 2 tablespoons vinegar 2 tablespoons ketchup, or more to taste 1 pound baby shallots, peeled Directions Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add beef, onion, and garlic; cook and stir until meat is browned on all sides and onion is translucent, 6 to 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, rosemary, pepper, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about 3 minutes. Stir in wine and vinegar. Pour beef mixture into a slow cooker and stir in ketchup. Cover and cook on Low until beef is tender, 6 to 8 hours. Meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet. Add shallots and sauté until soft, 3 to 4 minutes. Add cooked shallots to stew for the last 1 to 2 hours of cooking. Remove and discard cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and rosemary sprig before serving. I Made It Print 40 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 378 Calories 16g Fat 21g Carbs 31g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 378 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 20% Saturated Fat 4g 22% Cholesterol 80mg 27% Sodium 261mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 21g 7% Dietary Fiber 2g 7% Total Sugars 7g Protein 31g 61% Vitamin C 14mg 16% Calcium 77mg 6% Iron 6mg 31% Potassium 781mg 17% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Beef Stifado in the Slow Cooker 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  FrackFamily5 CACT 12/30/2020 Making this in the Instant Pot was a breeze. You can sauté then switch to the slow cook method- Easy!! The meat in this stew was delicious. I loved the warm spices. My store did not have baby shallot so I subbed onions. I think I would have preferred chunked up onion. The sauce flavor was good and needs much salt, so make sure to season your meat and add more before serving. I served it over egg noodles, with crusty bread and with a side of broccoli for added veggies. 1 You’ll Also Love Make-Ahead Slow Cooker Beef Stew 368 Ratings Slow Cooker Island Beef 49 Ratings Greek Style Beef Stew 11 Ratings Slow Cooker Smoked Oxtail and Sweet Potato Stew 5 Ratings Cozy Cottage Beef Stew Soup 64 Ratings Kid-Friendly Ground Beef Stew 3 Ratings Spicy Beef Curry Stew for the Slow Cooker 300 Ratings Puerto Rican Beef Stew 9 Ratings No-Peek Beef Stew 139 Ratings Slow Cooker Beef Stew 5,467 Ratings Slow Cooker Oxtail Stew 21 Ratings Slow Cooker Beef Round Stew 25 Ratings Christmas Eve Beef Stew 178 Ratings Hearty Slow Cooker Beef Stew 35 Ratings Slow Cooker Mediterranean Beef with Artichokes 96 Ratings Prep-Ahead Slow Cooker Beef Stew 59 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Allrecipes Member
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add beef, onion, and garlic; cook and stir until meat is browned on all sides and onion is translucent, 6 to 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, rosemary, pepper, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about 3 minutes. Stir in wine and vinegar.;Pour beef mixture into a slow cooker and stir in ketchup. Cover and cook on Low until beef is tender, 6 to 8 hours.;Meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet. Add shallots and sauté until soft, 3 to 4 minutes. Add cooked shallots to stew for the last 1 to 2 hours of cooking.;Remove and discard cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and rosemary sprig before serving.
